title: Crossing the Line: Aiming towards Truth? or an Image that Teaches Lies? Separating Icons from Idols
description:
Karen and Michael discuss all the various iterations, definitions and ramifications of current and past usage of icons and idols.

Video links and book references follow notes;

We delve into 
perceptions v. reality
the limits of human knowledge
accuracy of communication v. fullness of expression
the infinitude of divine goodness and beauty
zombification of words
the unreasonable effectiveness of mathematics
idol or icon:  Is it closing off data that I can't see? or opening up to more data than I can see.
We avoid too much complexity for fear it may overwhelm us.
the difference between recognition v. recall in terms of knowledge banks
iconic v. iconoclast
the drive for being seen as innovative can lead to strange places

If we seek a relationship with reality, we gain wisdom and are grounded in humility.

Is the map opening up more reality to me?
What is the infinity you are not capturing in your models.

For the biology videos, view them in this order for maximum effect:-)

Cell Signaling Technologies: https://www.digizyme.com/cst_landscapes.html

Energy Conversion Processes in a Light Harvesting Organelle
https://youtu.be/6hKq5A__yrY

Winner best scientific visualization of energy source of life:
https://youtu.be/NTgAok6n7I4

Jordan Peterson shows a video of DNA replicating itself:
https://youtu.be/fkjwL6gnvoA

Conversation with Max Tegmark and others about math and reality
https://youtu.be/VN19VOMHxkk

Speaker's Meaning by Owen Barfield
Saving the Appearances: a Study in Idolatry by Owen Barfield
Maps of Meaning by Jordan Peterson
Less than Words Can Say by Richard Mitchell
The Graves of Academe by Richard Mitchell
